SENT.plain: Beckwith-Wiedemann syndrome (BWS) is an overgrowth syndrome associated with congenital malformations and tumour predisposition
BWS results from variable mutations or epigenetic modifications of imprinted genes in the 11p15 chromosomal region
We present a fetus with mild general overgrowth and bilateral enlarged echogenic kidneys with loss of the corticomedullary differentiation in which prenatal diagnosis of BWS was suspected
The rest of the fetal anatomy and the amniotic fluid volume appeared normal
After termination of the pregnancy, molecular analysis confirmed the diagnosis of BWS by showing an isolated hypermethylation of the H19 gene
